intro: Agrostophyllum ambangense, commonly known as the Ambangense fern, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae, which includes various types of ferns and mosses. The plant is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are often covered in a layer of fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
